Let G be a non-elementary hyperbolic group and let Gn be the subgroup generated by the nth powers of the elements of G.
a) (M. Gromov). Is it true that G/Gn is infinite for some n = n(G)?
b) Is it true that

answer: a) Yes, it is; b) Yes, it is (S. V. Ivanov, A. Yu. Olshanskii, Trans. Amer. Math. Soc., 348, N 6 (1996), 2091–2138).
